description:
The classic Microsoft app, reimagined as an Archipelago game! Find your tools, expand your canvas, and paint the
greatest image the world has ever seen.

v0.1.0.description:
### APWorld changes
- New feature: Deathlink - sends a death when undoing or clearing; clears image and history when a death is received
- Fixed an issue that could cause excess items to be generated when playing with traps on low difficulty

### Client changes
- Implemented traps
- Implemented deathlink
- Implemented embedded text client, accessible under the Extras menu
- Inverted the background colors on the default target image to hopefully increase difficulty
- Custom images can now be used as target images when uploaded through File->Open (Note that these will be forcibly stretched to 800x600 and, if any transparency is present, will overlay on top of the default image)
- Added a section for Archipelago-specific help under the Help Topics popup
- Fixed an issue where excessive duplicate progression items were not properly ignored and could cause the canvas to expand beyond its intended bounds
- Fixed an issue where undo/redo could revert a received canvas size upgrade

Hosted client is available at https://mariomantaw.github.io/jspaint/ and is backwards-compatible with seeds generated on v0.0.0.
v0.1.0.title: v0.1.0

v0.2.0.description:
### APWorld changes:
- New Feature: Custom Starting Tool - choose whether to start with Brush or Pencil
- Maximum number of traps has been increased from 35 to 50
- Changed logic to match updated similarity calculation client-side
- Added version info to slot data

### Client changes:
- Changed similarity calculation, slightly reducing false positives
- Added code to check APWorld version, allowing permanent backwards compatibility
- File->New now sends a deathlink
- Forced client to English, fixing an issue with tools not being received properly
- Disabled Select All functionality when the Select tool has not been obtained

Hosted client is available at https://mariomantaw.github.io/jspaint and beginning with this release, the default YAML is included below.
v0.2.0.title: v0.2.0

v0.3.0.description:
### APWorld changes
- Eraser, Airbrush, Line, Rectangle, Ellipse, and Rounded Rectangle are now selectable as starting tools

### Client changes
- Implemented auto-save functionality
-- Drawings will automatically save whenever a change is made and persist upon refresh
-- Note that storage is tied to an auto-generated unique string at the end of the URL, this means that opening a new paint tab will allow connecting to different slots/multiworlds with a blank slate but closing and re-opening will lose all progress unless the URL is saved
- Fixed a bug where color depth restrictions were not correctly applied while drawing
- Added disconnect handling so users will be redirected to the login page upon disconnect rather than causing an error
- Fixed a bug affecting pre-0.2.0 seeds where similarity was not calculated correctly and could result in similarity above 100%
- Fixed a bug where the Pick Color tool would not correctly select colors from the goal canvas if the selected area had not been unlocked on the main canvas
- Fixed a bug where moving the cursor to the goal canvas while drawing would teleport the cursor left and continue drawing

Hosted client is available at https://mariomantaw.github.io/jspaint
v0.3.0.title: v0.3.0

v0.4.0.description:
### APWorld changes
- New options: Half Percent Checks and Quarter Percent Checks - input a number less than the Logic Percent to add locations for fractional percents above this threshold.
- Trap Count is now Trap Fill Percentage and will specify the percentage of filler to be replaced by traps rather than a fixed number.
- Goal image is now a hidden option, as the ability to load a custom image obsoletes it. The option will still work for backwards compatibility.

### Client changes
- The preview panes for the Pick Color tool and the Edit Colors window will now display valid colors in real time rather than suddenly snapping after selection.
- Added defaults for host and port on connection page. (#1)
- Added an error popup that will display if the Archipelago connection fails.
- Fixed an issue with difference mode canvas that caused it to be incorrectly sized/placed while zoomed in.

Hosted client is available at https://mariomantaw.github.io/jspaint
v0.4.0.title: v0.4.0

v0.4.1.description:
### APWorld changes
- Implemented start_inventory_from_pool.

### Client changes
- Both the color palette and the goal image now auto-save.
- You can now shift-click on a palette to save your currently selected color.
- Selections made with the Select or Free-Form Select tools can now be resized.
- Added an Enlarge UI option for accessibility.
- Added client and APWorld version info to the About Paint popup.
- Fixed an issue which caused certain messages in the text client to have unwanted commas.

Hosted client is available at https://mariomantaw.github.io/jspaint and all features added in this version are backwards-compatible with any APWorld version.
v0.4.1.title: v0.4.1

v0.5.0.description:
### APWorld changes
- New option: Canvas Size Increment - choose whether Progressive Canvas Width/Height items expand the canvas by 25, 50, or 100 pixels.
- Implemented logic for new similarity calculation on client. The new logic is significantly harder so keep that in mind if updating an existing YAML.

### Client changes
- Similarity calculation has been updated to be more natural and less lenient; in exchange, you will start with 1 color depth in each component to ensure early progress is possible.
- Archipelago connection info is now automatically saved and will be persistent upon refresh.
- Similarity will now automatically update when connecting or receiving items. Checks will not automatically send until user action is taken.
- Similarity will now automatically update when undoing and redoing changes.
- The Pick Color tool can now be used on the goal canvas even when in Difference Mode.
- Traps sent by /send or !getitem now activate properly.
- Fixed a bug where traps and chat messages would sometimes be duplicated when reconnecting.
- Fixed a bug where the pointer location was calculated incorrectly on the goal canvas, causing the Pick Color tool to be offset slightly.
- Fixed a bug where the text client would not re-open correctly after being closed.
- Fixed a bug where palette colors were not properly validated against received color depth.

Hosted client is available at https://mariomantaw.github.io/jspaint and is backwards-compatible with all APWorld versions.
v0.5.0.title: v0.5.0

v0.5.1.description:
### APWorld changes
- Disallowed certain settings that were prone to generation failures for single-player games. Multiworlds generated with these settings will no longer have the Pick Color tool forced early and local.

### Client changes
- Negative similarity will now be displayed accurately, rather than always being displayed as zero.
- Fixed a bug where the Edit Colors window would not display correctly while in Enlarge UI mode.

Hosted client is available at https://mariomantaw.github.io/jspaint and is backwards-compatible with all APWorld versions.
v0.5.1.title: v0.5.1

v0.5.2.description:
### APWorld changes
- Updated documentation to match new client changes.

### Client changes
- New feature: Similarity Mode (Ctrl+Shift+M) - somewhat similar to the existing Difference Mode, but shows the calculated similarity in grayscale with white representing perfect similarity and black representing no similarity.
- File->Open has been renamed to File->Open Goal Image.
- Updated Archipelago help.

Hosted client is available at https://mariomantaw.github.io/jspaint and is backwards-compatible (including new features) with all APWorld versions.
v0.5.2.title: v0.5.2

v0.5.3.description:
### APWorld changes
- Updated to latest peer-reviewed version. No new features.

### Client changes
- New feature: Side-by-Side Mode - displays the canvas and goal image side-by-side when zoomed in or on a small screen.
- Text client now opens at a fixed size so it will always fit on screen.
- Removed 90-degree rotation hotkeys that allowed accidental image rotation and unexpected aspect ratios.
- History now updates when loading a save so undoing immediately does not reset all progress.

Hosted client is available at https://mariomantaw.github.io/jspaint and is backwards-compatible (including new features) with all APWorld versions.
v0.5.3.title: v0.5.3

v0.6.0.description:
### APWorld changes
- The Canvas Size Increment option has been split into 2 separate options for Canvas Width Increment and Canvas Height Increment. Be sure to use these new options when updating an existing YAML.
- New option: Aspect Ratio - choose whether your final image will be fullscreen (800x600), widescreen (800x450), square (800x800), fullscreen vertical (600x800), or widescreen vertical (450x800).

### Client changes
- The storage system has been reworked. Now, manually loading saved data via the Manage Storage popup will load all information associated with that session, including current canvas, target image, and connection info at once. The thumbnail will also show both the current canvas and goal side-by-side.
- Added new images and backend code to support new APWorld features.

Hosted client is available at https://mariomantaw.github.io/jspaint and is backwards-compatible (including new features) with all APWorld versions.
v0.6.0.title: v0.6.0

v0.6.1.description:
### APWorld changes
- New traps: Help Trap, Zoom In Trap, Zoom Out Trap, Tool Swap Trap
- New option: Trap Blacklist
- New option: Trap Link

### Client changes
- Implemented new traps and trap-related options

Hosted client is available at https://mariomantaw.github.io/jspaint and is backwards-compatible with all APWorld versions.
v0.6.1.title: v0.6.1
